p.k: Toots Thielemans: A Jazz Legend 2009. Toots Thielemans. Belgium
p.d: The harmonica player Toots Thielemans was born in Brussels, in 1922. He started playing the accordion at three years old, and when he was a child, he often played at his parents' caf√©. As an teenager, Thielemans mastered the harmonica, and then the guitar. In this documentary, Toots speaks about his rise to success. He explores his childhood in Brussels, his achievements in the United States, and his current status as a renown international musician. Toots' long career is illustrated with archive footage and interviews with his mother, his manager, the seasoned comedian Raymond Devos, his rock star friends Paul Simon, Billy Joel, and Ozark Henry, his peers Herbie Hancock, Kenny Werner, Jaco Pastorius, and many more.
